name: Flamingo Conference Resort & Spa

reviews.title: clean and comfortable rooms, great food in the Terrace Grill
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel during a conference. Found hotel personal very friendly and helpful. Had a great meal in the hotels restaurant.
My wife used the hotel spa, which is on hotel property but was a little removed from our room. She had one of her best facials ever.
reviews.title: Great hotel, best in sonoma

reviews.text: I was hesitant of what I had booked, as the price was so reasonable. Upon ariiving in the parking lot, we too noticed the dated looking Flamingo. The grounds and pool were beautiful and well manicured. But a big Ah-Ha awaited us as we discovered a diamond of a gem hotel. Very nice front desk reception by Angela, who worked it out so we had three rooms together. The beds were outstanding, excellent linens and clean as can be. I did not like paying for wifi connection. It should be included. The location to the wine country was perfect and having the nice city of Santa Rosa nearby was helpful. We had two breakfasts and one dinner at the adjacent restaurant, Lyons. You might think we are crazy, but the food and prices were so affordable, we just kept going back. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved the Flamingo
Nice Hotel for the Price
reviews.text: We stayed at the Flamingo for a long weekend in wine country. It is a good 'home-base' for touring Napa and Sonoma. Approx 20 minute drive to Napa and very close to the northern Sonoma areas (we loved Russian River valley). It was the most reasonably priced of all the places I researched and we weren't disappointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we drove into the hotel, we were a bit worried by the huge neon sign, but then we were pleasantly surprised with the inside of the resort. Our room was very large and comfortable. It appeared to have been recently updated and the bathrooms were very nice and clean. We had a very tasty, reasonably priced breakfast at the hotel restaraunt.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Classic California style with modern upgrades

reviews.text: Hotel has a rotating giant flamingo on the roof–wow–just like Vegas. The hotel is being updated with some construction. In spite of this the hotel is well maintained and comfortable. Construction noise is toward the front of the hotel, and does not intrude into the interior. Rooms were nice with very comfortable beds, and very clean. The hotel is well located for touring the wine country. I would stay here again. The downside–several amenities are missing from the ones listed on the website. A free continental breakfast was listed, but not available. If you wish to spend about $8 they have a restaurant–not a bad price for breakfast. When we expressed surprise the staff said other items on their web list are no longer available– picnic tables for example. If any of their “offerings” are important to you-check on them with the hotel first. They offer newspapers–charge; telephones-charge ($.50 local); etc. A little nickel and dime as compared to other hotels. We were charged 107.10/night which is fairly inexpensive for this area. We booked through AAA–the hotel charged us $116/night, and could not believe we had such a “low” rate. They honored our original reservation price–take a printout of your confirmation. I really hate when a web site is incorrect as to facilities, since the website is easily updated. We walked to an I HOP next door for breakfast–probably would have done the same if it had been twice the cost, and ten feet of snow.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Santa Rosa

reviews.text: This is really an updated motel, but it is clean and has a lot of nice features. The decor looked like they were trying to replicate an english manor of some sort - the living room area of our suite had a library and a bulky desk, all made of dark wood. Given the motel aesthetic still present throughout the rest of the property, some 50's kitsch would have been better, or at least a more contemporary and airy feel. Still, bed was comfortable and room was clean. We could hear every footstep of our upstairs neighbor, but noticed nothing through the other walls.
reviews.title: Updated motel, comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool was packed with kids - definitely not for adult enjoyment. Breakfast in the restaurant was fine. Staff was helpful. Hotel is conveniently located for exploration of wine country.
reviews.title: Expected Little, Got a Lot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, you can find a reasonably-priced accommodation in wine country! My husband and I booked a $79/night deal through TravelZoo and had our expectations set fairly low -- especially after spotting the rotating KFC-esque flamingo sign in front of the resort -- but we simply wanted a place to sleep and shower while we explored Sonoma county. Our queen room was clean and spacious, the furniture was up to date, the service courteous and we rarely heard a peep throughout the hotel (even though the parking lot was always full). Not only were we happy with the Flamingo, but we also found the town of Santa Rosa to be a delight. Be sure to window-shop at Zap Cars and make time for the Charles Schulz Museum. Third Street Aleworks in downtown makes some mean brews that go perfect with their addictive garlic-parmesan fries.
reviews.title: Fairly cheap but so-so
Great Experience
reviews.text: We found a "deal" through Travel Zoo that seemed very reasonable. We paid more for an upgrade to the regular Executive King room thinking it would include a patio or balcony, it didn't. Extra was for a sofa bed which we didn't need. By the time we checked in (3:00, the time they tell you to) the only regular Executive King rooms left only had 2 double beds. We were also stuck on the bottom floor, they didn't have any upstairs rooms left. The olympic size pool was filled the entire time with local kids (many taking lessons), very noisy and not at all relaxing. Walls in the hotel were very thin. We were unfortunate enough to be next to someone who stayed up talking and playing music all night. Hotel staff were helpful. Part of the "deal" was 1/2 price for food & wine pairing at Kendall Jackson - Good! The biggest downsides were the pool, it was packed, and the thin walls. There are tennis courts as part of a community center behind the hotel which we had do problem getting to play on in the mornings.

reviews.title: Home away from home
reviews.text: I loved this hotel. It was affordable in a very over-priced area and left me money to pay for things I wanted to buy and experience and not blow everything on the room. The health club and spa are fabulous. Really 5 star. I had a foot ritual at the spa. A lovely foot and leg masage with hot stones in a lovely relaxing room. The massage was one of the best I had ever had. The food in the restuaurant was great. I had heard it was so-so but they apparently have a new chef and I thought it was really good. On par with some of the fancier higher priced places nearby. And, everything is nearby! We wanted to really explore the area and we were just about in the middle of everything. Sonoma, Healdsburg, the Ocean, the redwoods were all about 20 to 30 minutes away. The people at the hotel were all polite, helpful and knew their jobs. They were helpful with everything I needed. The hotel is not fancy but is very clean and well run. I would recommend it to everyone who was intersted in a good, well-run affordable expereince.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort entrance was being renovated, the lobby was plain but I was delighted to be received by front desk staffer with a smile and an "upgrade." Considering I had booked through Priceline this was delightful news. Our room was very spacious. The bed had a great mattress with loads of pillows. The best surprise was the pool area. The hotel which appears to have been renovated had a large pool and comfortable feeling pool area. We met people who had return here year after year. I can see why. Freeway access is a short drive away.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel for a very nice price

likes.liked: — Great ambiance of the entire resort

reviews.text: My family and I stay at the Flamingo at least once a year. I have wonderful memories of being there at the pool with my family. It really is a special place. This year, they have done updates to the rooms and the pool furniture. Everything they have done looks really nice. I am also glad that we didn't get "tagged" at the pool this year. I don't know if that was just a coincidence or if they stopped doing it, but we weren't bothered at all. I work at a hotel and I am jealous. I wish I could work there. I'm sure the staff gets no complaints, which is exactly what my family and I had.
reviews.title: The usual nice stay, now even better
Way nicer than the reviews
reviews.text: Some reviews are were a bit harsh about this property. I stayed here in late July 2007 and I was delighted with the place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large, service was friendly and security was great. There's no chance of unauthorized people wandering around here. The bed was comfortable and I didn't hear anyone else.
reviews.title: Worth the online prices

reviews.text: The pool runs a modern salt system to get the chlorine and it was wonderful to use, clean and very few people around. I stayed there from a Monday to Friday so maybe weekends are not the same, but I wonder about that.
reviews.title: Great location for Wine Country

description: Historic Landmark located between Sonoma Valley Wineries and downtown Santa Rosa, walking distance to upscale Shopping Montgomery Village, 5 restaurants, 24 hr CVS Pharmacy and Safeway/Starbucks. Full service affordable Destination Resort with 8 treatment rooms Spa featuring a Couples Massage, facials, manicure, pedicure, Vichy Body Scrub,2 Olympic size Outdoor heated Pools, 5 Tennis Courts with Pro, 8,000 Sq ft Montecito Heghts Health Club with child care, personal trainers, Indoor Cycle and Warm Yoga Studios,Free Parking, 170 rooms including 13 Pool view Suites,newly remodeled Executive Kings,Pet friendly rooms upon request,Family rooms-3-4 beds; all non Smoking rooms with mini refrigerators, King or dbl-dbl size beds, complimentary Wine and Cheese tasting every Friday 5-7pm, Poolside Dining, Lounge with nightly entertainment- dancing on weekends, Salsa Sundays,3-6pm Happy Hour,2 Bars,Healthy menu choices, Sunday Champagne Brunch, 15 function rooms 15,000 sq ft of function space
